bibl.title: "Winged Words": Poetry and Divination in Posidippus' Oiônoskopika.
bibl.note: P. Mil. Vogl. VIII, 309, coll. iv, 8-vi, 8 = 21-35 Austin-Bastianini. - [Introduction.] - I. Title and Topic. - II. Internal Ergänzungsspiel. - III. Bird-augury and Mantic Practice. - IV. Posidippus' Oiônoskopika and Mantic Practice. - V. Poetry and Didactics in the Oiônoskopika - the Literary Tradition. - VI. The Invention of Oiônoskopika as an Epigrammatic Subgenre. - VII. Topics and Structure of the Oiônoskopika.

bibl.title: Labored in Papyrus Leaves: Perspectives on an Epigram Collection Attributed to Posidippus (P. Mil. Vogl. VIII 309)

bibl.seg: BAUMBACH Manuel and Kai TRAMPEDACH, "Winged Words": Poetry and Divination in Posidippus' Oiônoskopika.

Benjamin ACOSTA-HUGHES, Elizabeth KOSMETATOU and Manuel BAUMBACH (Edd.), Labored in Papyrus Leaves: Perspectives on an Epigram Collection Attributed to Posidippus (P. Mil. Vogl. VIII 309) = Hellenic Studies. 2 (Washington, D.C. - Cambridge, Mass. - London, 2004) pp. 123-160, 1 tabl.

P. Mil. Vogl. VIII, 309, coll. iv, 8-vi, 8 = 21-35 Austin-Bastianini. - [Introduction.] - I. Title and Topic. - II. Internal Ergänzungsspiel. - III. Bird-augury and Mantic Practice. - IV. Posidippus' Oiônoskopika and Mantic Practice. - V. Poetry and Didactics in the Oiônoskopika - the Literary Tradition. - VI. The Invention of Oiônoskopika as an Epigrammatic Subgenre. - VII. Topics and Structure of the Oiônoskopika.
